entry.title: The Community Care (Delayed Discharges etc.) Act (Qualifying Services) (England) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe certain services and require local authorities to provide those services free of charge to the person to whom the service is provided, and make certain other provision in relation to the timing of the requirement to provide them for free.

entry.title: The Civil Procedure (Amendment No. 2) Rules 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: The amendment of section 51(2) of the Supreme Court Act 1981 on the entry into force of section 31 of the Access to Justice Act 1999 allows rules of court to be made “for securing that the amount awarded to a party in respect of the costs to be paid by him to [legal or other] representatives is not limited to what would have been payable by him to them if he had not been awarded costs”—in other words, rules which limit or regulate the so-called indemnity principle.

entry.title: The Conditional Fee Agreements (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: Section 58(1) of the Courts and Legal Services Act 1990 provides that a conditional fee agreement is not unenforceable if it satisfies the conditions applicable by and under that section, which include conditions specified in Regulations made by the Lord Chancellor under section 58(3)(c). These Regulations make amendments to the Conditional Fee Agreements Regulations 2000 and the Collective Conditional Fee Agreements Regulations 2000 to provide that a conditional fee agreement will be enforceable even though the client is liable to pay his legal representative’s fees and expenses only if and to the extent that he recovers damages or costs in the proceedings. Amendments made to the Civil Procedure Rules 1998 provide that costs payable under such a conditional fee agreement are recoverable under Parts 44 to 48 of those Rules.

entry.title: The Access to Justice Act 1999 (Commencement No. 10) Order 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 2nd June 2003 section 31 of the Access to Justice Act 1999. This section amends section 51(2) of the Supreme Court Act 1981, allowing rules of court to be made “for securing that the amount awarded to a party in respect of the costs to be paid by him to [legal or other] representatives is not limited to what would have been payable by him to them if he had not been awarded costs”—in other words, rules which limit or regulate the so-called indemnity principle. Amendments to this effect have been made to the Civil Procedure Rules 1998.

entry.title: The Social Security (Hospital In-Patients and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Hospital In-Patients) Regulations 1975 in respect of specified benefits and other regulations in respect of income support, housing benefit, council tax benefit, jobseeker’s allowance, state pension credit and child support maintenance calculations.

entry.title: The Social Security and Child Support (Miscellaneous Amendments) (No. 2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security and Child Support (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2003 (“the Miscellaneous Amendments Regulations”) which contained no express commencement date for regulation 6.

entry.title: The Safety of Sports Grounds (Designation) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order designates the Neasham Road stadium in Darlington and the National Hockey Stadium and Conference Centre in Central Milton Keynes as sports grounds requiring a safety certificate under the Safety of Sports Ground Act 1975.

entry.title: The A339 Trunk Road (B4640 Swan Roundabout to West Berkshire/Hampshire County Boundary) (Detrunking) Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The A339 Trunk Road (B4640 Swan Roundabout to West Berkshire/Hampshire County Boundary) (Detrunking) Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Carers and Disabled Children Act 2000 (Commencement No. 2) (England) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force in England on 30th April 2003 the provisions of the Carers and Disabled Children Act 2000 (“the Act”) which are not already in force in England.

entry.title: The A339 Trunk Road (B4640 County Boundary (R. Enborne) to A339 Swan Roundabout and A339 Swan Roundabout to A34/A339 Junction) (Detrunking) Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The A339 Trunk Road (B4640 County Boundary (R. Enborne) to A339 Swan Roundabout and A339 Swan Roundabout to A34/A339 Junction) (Detrunking) Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The General Teaching Council for England (Disciplinary Functions) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the General Teaching Council for England (Disciplinary Functions) Regulations 2001 (“the Disciplinary Regulations”).

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Collective Investment Schemes) (Designated Countries and Territories) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order designates territories, and specifies classes of collective investment scheme, for the purposes of section 270 of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (“the Act”). An operator of a collective investment scheme which falls within a class specified by this Order and which is managed in, and authorised under the law of, a territory outside the United Kingdom which is designated by this Order, may give notice to the Financial Services Authority that he wishes the scheme to be recognised. If the Financial Services Authority gives its approval to the scheme being recognised, the scheme is a “recognised scheme” for the purposes of Part XVII of the Act.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Costs of Inquiries etc.)(Examination in Public) (England) Regulations 2003

category.term: TOWN AND COUNTRY PLANNING, ENGLAND;TRIBUNALS AND INQUIRIES, ENGLAND

entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in England only, apply in relation to any person who is after 23rd May 2003 appointed to conduct, or is appointed as one of the persons who are to conduct, an examination in public under section 35B(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and whose remuneration, and travelling or subsistence allowances (if any), in respect of the appointment are to be paid by the local planning authority.

entry.title: Education (Prohibition from Teaching or Working with Children) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Education (Restriction of Employment) Regulations 2000 and make provision for the supply of information to the Secretary of State, procedures for giving a direction under section 142 of the Education Act 2002, the grounds on which a person subject to such a direction may seek to have it varied or revoked and the procedure for appeals and reviews of such directions.

entry.title: The Sweeteners in Food (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to England only, further amend the Sweeteners in Food Regulations 1995 (S.I. 1995/3123, as already amended) (“the 1995 Regulations”), which extend to the whole of Great Britain, by—granting authorisation for the marketing and use as a sweetener of salt of aspartame–acesulfame, as permitted by Article 5 of Directive 89/107/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the member States concerning food additives authorised for use in foodstuffs intended for human consumption (OJ No. L40, 11.2.89, p.27). Article 5 permits member States to authorise sweeteners for the marketing and use within their own territories, pending consideration for inclusion in Directive 94/35/EC on sweeteners for use in foodstuffs (OJ No. L237, 10.9.94, p.3, as amended) (regulation 2(2) and (5));clarifying the meaning of “maximum usable dose” as used in relation to cyclamic acid and its Na and Ca salts and saccharin and its Na, K and Ca salts (regulation 2(3));making a consequential change to regulation 3(3) of the 1995 Regulations. (regulation 2(4)); andupdating references to the 1995 Regulations in other Regulations to take account of the amendments made to the 1995 Regulations by these Regulations (regulation 3).

entry.title: The Statutory Paternity Pay (Adoption) and Statutory Adoption Pay (Adoptions from Overseas) (No. 2) Regulation 2003
entry.summary: This instrument contains only regulations made by virtue of sections 2, 4 and 53 of, and paragraphs 8 and 11 of Schedule 7 to, the Employment Act 2002, which came into force on 8th December 2002. The instrument is made before the end of the period of 6 months beginning with the coming into force of those provisions. The regulations in it are therefore exempted by section 173(5)(b) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 from the requirement under section 172 of that Act to refer the proposals to make the regulations to the Social Security Advisory Committee and they are made without reference to the Committee.

entry.title: The Commonwealth Development Corporation (Exempt Period) (Appointed Day) Order 2003
entry.summary: Paragraph 1 of Schedule 3 to the Commonwealth Development Corporation Act 1999 provides for an exempt period during which the Commonwealth Development Corporation will not be chargeable to corporation tax or tax by virtue of section 747(4)(a) of the Income and Corporation Taxes Act 1988 (1988 c. 1: section 747 provides for the imputation of chargeable profits and creditable tax of controlled foreign companies).

entry.title: The A45 Trunk Road (A45/A46 Stonebridge Highway Island, Coventry to the A45/A452 Stonebridge Island) (Detrunking) Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The A45 Trunk Road (A45/A46 Stonebridge Highway Island, Coventry to the A45/A452 Stonebridge Island) (Detrunking) Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The A34 Trunk Road (A34/A500 Talke Roundabout, Staffordshire to the A5011 Linley Road, Staffordshire) (Detrunking) Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The A34 Trunk Road (A34/A500 Talke Roundabout, Staffordshire to the A5011 Linley Road, Staffordshire) (Detrunking) Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: Adoption (Bringing Children into the United Kingdom) Regulations 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations impose requirements and conditions in respect of a person who is habitually resident in the British Islands and who—
